issue.title: Get all connected agents status
issue.body: it would be useful to receive from the listAgentStatuses api not only the routable offline custom statuses but also the activity statuses (busy, pending busy, missed ... etc) to know in real time the status of the other connected agents

comment.body: Following up from late 2023, are there any plans to retrieve this data through an API without navigating to the Connect website and viewing it manually? Even if it's an API as a part of [the Client Connect SDK](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaScriptSDK/v3/latest/clients/client-connect/) or somewhere else, it'd be useful to have that data available.

issue.title: Disable quick connect until a condition is met
issue.body:
Hey team,
We use the custom ccp as an app for our contact centers. We heavily use quick connects for transfers. However, we have a new requirement where we want to disable the DOM for quick connect until the agent has filled the transfer summary in a separate modal. 
Since the containerDiv is an iframe and we don't have access to the DOM I believe, but is there a way we can access this DOM and disable it and then enable it again?

comment.body: We don't take feature requests in github. Please contact the official Amazon Connect support and have them file a ticket to us.https://aws.amazon.com/contact-us/?nc2=h_header

issue.title: How can I access the data of other connected agents?
issue.body:
Hi,

How can I get the data of other agents connected to the CCP?
I would like to transfer call between agents, but I can't find how to see if there are other agents connected or not. 
I tried to use agent.getContacts(), but it returns an empty array.
Thanks

issue.body: With embedded CCP the Javascript Console output drowns out everything with its verbosity! Please please provide a way to control the log level for the embedded CCP use-case.

issue.title: Rejecting a contact doesn't trigger onMissed, onEnded or onError
issue.body:
As per the docs for `onMissed`:

```This is an event which is fired when a contact is put in state "missed" by the backend, which happens when the agent does not answer for a certain amount of time, when the agent rejects the call```

Our current implementation has to rely on `contact.onRefresh` to determine whether a contact is rejected, which is now beginning to cause issues. None of the callbacks on a contact are called after a contact is rejected.

Is this a bug or is there another way to get a callback for rejected? We are rejecting by calling `contact.reject()`.

comment.body: Hey, for CCP, we use the ``onMissed`` API for both missed and rejected contacts. Inside the callback that we pass to ``onMissed`` we check if the contact status is MISSED or REJECTED and determine following actions from there. You can check the contact's status [here](https://github.com/amazon-connect/amazon-connect-streams/blob/master/Documentation.md#contactgetstate--contactgetstatus)

issue.title: Can't logout from Custom CCP with third-party-cookie phaseout
issue.body:
I am working on a custom CCP using Streams v2.7.2, with the embedded CCP set to hidden. In order to handle third-party cookies as per the instructions on this [page](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/connect/latest/adminguide/admin-3pcookies.html), I have enabled Chrome's experimental feature test-third-party-cookie-phaseout. However, when attempting to logout from the CCP using the following code, but can't logout.

```
fetch("https://<xxxxxxxxx>/connect/logout", { credentials: 'include', mode: 'no-cors'})
```

It appears the request is being made without attaching any cookies.
![スクリーンショット 2023-10-04 11 27 26](https://github.com/amazon-connect/amazon-connect-streams/assets/34177860/81fb185b-df60-4b7b-baab-131a52e43ca4)

How can I resolve this issue to ensure a successful logout from the CCP?
Is the only solution to utilize first-party cookies for logging out by opening the logout URL in a separate window?

issue.title: Rejecting a contact doesn't trigger onMissed, onEnded or onError
issue.body:
As per the docs for `onMissed`:

```This is an event which is fired when a contact is put in state "missed" by the backend, which happens when the agent does not answer for a certain amount of time, when the agent rejects the call```

Our current implementation has to rely on `contact.onRefresh` to determine whether a contact is rejected, which is now beginning to cause issues. None of the callbacks on a contact are called after a contact is rejected.

Is this a bug or is there another way to get a callback for rejected? We are rejecting by calling `contact.reject()`.

comment.body:
Note, rejected calls seems to trigger `onMissed`, but have an "error" state so it's impossible to know whether they are rejected or missed.

If you look at the CCP, rejecting an incoming call triggers a softphone error and missed state incorrectly.

issue.title: Issues with implementing 3P Cookie phaseout update
issue.body: Hi there, I am working on updating our Agent app that has a custom CCP to get it ready for the 3P cookie phaseout, but I am struggling with properly implementing and testing the behavior of the new RSA banner. I followed the instructions on implementing the 3P phaseout update in the documentation ([here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/connect/latest/adminguide/admin-3pcookies.html)) and my browser has the following flags turned on: I tested the RSA banner by disabling 3P cookies in my browser settings: This way, I was able to trigger the RSA banner in my app: However, whenever I click on the 'Grant Access' button, it simply turns into the deny RSA banner: Also, as I was updating this yesterday, I was still probably signed in to my session from the older version on my local machine. However, when I am trying to sign in today, with the 3P cookies setting turned on (**so that 3P cookies are allowed**), **I am now unable to sign in at all**, and the blue RSA banner asking me to Grant Access shows up, but the same issue occurs - the banner just changes to the deny (yellow one) and I can't sign in. This is what shows up in my logs: Fyi this is the configuration of my CCP: ```typescript const ccpConfig: connect.InitCCPOptions = { ccpUrl: app.ccpUrl, loginUrl: app.loginUrl, loginPopup: true, loginPopupAutoClose: true, loginOptions: { autoClose: true, height: 600, width: 400, top: 0, left: 0, }, softphone: { allowFramedSoftphone: true, }, storageAccess: { canRequest: true, mode: 'custom', }, }; ``` Any ideas on how to fix this issue with the banner and how to test the functionality of the 3P cookie phaseout before it goes live?

comment.body:
If you embed the CCP via streams (for example, in Salesforce) and your agents never log in directly to the Connect site, you'll run into the "request denied because the embedded" issue. We found a workaround, which is to have the agent log in at least once to Connect directly. After that, the third party workflow in the embedded CCP works as expected.

It's not a great work-around, but unsure how you can deal with this at a code-level as it sort of makes sense that Chrome wouldn't take a third party cookie for site the end user hasn't interacted with at top level, but I'm not a expert. Good luck and looking forward to a fix.

issue.title: Rejecting a contact doesn't trigger onMissed, onEnded or onError
issue.body:
As per the docs for `onMissed`:

```This is an event which is fired when a contact is put in state "missed" by the backend, which happens when the agent does not answer for a certain amount of time, when the agent rejects the call```

Our current implementation has to rely on `contact.onRefresh` to determine whether a contact is rejected, which is now beginning to cause issues. None of the callbacks on a contact are called after a contact is rejected.

Is this a bug or is there another way to get a callback for rejected? We are rejecting by calling `contact.reject()`.

issue.title: Determine if call is being recorded
issue.body:
Is there an system attribute or API that can tell me if a call is currently being recorded?

I really want to avoid manually setting a contact attribute after each set recording behavior block in the contact flows. It doesn't seem like streams API has anything that would indicate if a call is being recorded and if so, which parties. The Connect API doesn't seem to have a method like getContactRecordingStatus either.

As a bad work around I am calling startContactRecording on the contact to see if it errors with "Request is not allowed in current voice recording state". The down side is if it's not being recorded, there will now be a short recording while the stopContactRecording request is handled. 

Hopefully I'm missing some really easy way to do this. Any help is appreciated!

comment.body: Add this to the high priority list please AWS. 3 years outstanding for a highly asked for API

issue.title: Run async function when clicking "Call"

comment.body: This issue is stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment to keep this active.

issue.title: Uncaught (in promise) GumTimeout: Local media has not been initialized yet.
issue.body: I have developed a custom CCP using amazon connect streams. I works on local environment but when i deploy the streams and and my custom ccp code it throughs the error "Uncaught (in promise) GumTimeout: Local media has not been initialized yet.", Can somebody help me to resolve the issue ?

comment.body:
I have also experienced this issue with one of our users. 
We have found that after near exactly after 10.2 seconds of the inbound call ringing, firefox/connect will report a softphone error with the error "Uncaught (in promise) GumTimeout: Local media has not been initialized yet".

When the agent answers the call within that 10.2 seconds, the softphone will initalise correct 95% of the time.

issue.title: Cannot hold active initial connection after call has been monitored
issue.body:
I was able to reproduce this with the following setup: 

Multiparty mode = on
Supervisor configured with real-time monitoring and barge capabilities.

* Call comes in to non-supervisor agent
* Supervisor agent initiates monitoring via the realtime metrics page
* supervisor leaves the call.
* non-supervisor agent attempts to put caller on hold, and cannot do so.
* code example: 

```
var aic = contact.getActiveInitialConnection();
aic.isOnHold(); //  returns false
aic.hold({failure: (e) => console.log(e)});
```

This results in the following log: 

```
{
  "type": "InvalidStateException",
  "message": "Cannot put call on hold: Invalid contact state.",
  "stack": [
    "InvalidStateException: Cannot put call on hold: Invalid contact state.",
    "    at constructor.extractError (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:168929)",
    "    at constructor.callListeners (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:197245)",
    "    at constructor.emit (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:196955)",
    "    at constructor.emitEvent (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:190635)",
    "    at constructor.e (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:186152)",
    "    at r.runTo (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:224121)",
    "    at https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:224327",
    "    at constructor.<anonymous> (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:186422)",
    "    at constructor.<anonymous> (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:190691)",
    "    at constructor.callListeners (https://[my connect instance]-connect.my.connect.aws/connect/ccp-naws/static/streams/connect-streams-min.6382b4bd.js:1:197351)"
  ],
  "retryStatus": "none",
  "statusCode": 400
}
```

Note the contact state as reported here is `connected`

comment.body: It seems to be working now.

issue.title: Always connected delayed ~16 sec when its voice mail
issue.body:
I'm using SAML and CCP-v2. Whenever an outbound call is made from the AWS-SDK Node server, it takes time to actually connect from CCP on the browser, and I cannot hear the voicemail instruction. Normally, you should be able to hear something like, "The dial you made is currently not available; please leave a message after the tone." 

However, CCP almost always loses that first part and connects after 16 seconds. Meaning, you will never know if the call is actually connected to the recipient or connected to an answering machine (voicemail). How can I connect to voicemail immediately if the outbound call is missed?

comment.body: Hey, can you explain how you are starting an outbound call with the AWS-SDK and how the flow is connected with CCP here? Streams APIs support creating outbound calls which may help here. https://github.com/amazon-connect/amazon-connect-streams/blob/master/Documentation.md#agentconnect

issue.title: Uncaught (in promise) GumTimeout: Local media has not been initialized yet.
issue.body: I have developed a custom CCP using amazon connect streams. I works on local environment but when i deploy the streams and and my custom ccp code it throughs the error "Uncaught (in promise) GumTimeout: Local media has not been initialized yet.", Can somebody help me to resolve the issue ?

comment.body:
Is the issue still occurring for you?

Which browser are you using? For Firefox, GetUserMedia does not resolve unless the Firefox window is visible and in focus. If you click away and switch to another application, GetUserMedia will not resolve until you give Firefox focus.
